{{Attached KML|display=title}} [[File:Manhattan Ann Street.JPG|thumb|325px|right|"Quaint name, Ann Street. Width of same, ten feet." -Words of the song "Ann Street" by [[Charles Ives]]]] '''Ann Street''' is a 3-block-long street located in the [[Financial District, Manhattan|Financial District]] in [[Lower Manhattan]]. It runs roughly east to west from [[Broadway (Manhattan)|Broadway]] to [[Gold Street (Manhattan)|Gold Street]]. == History == [[File:Ann street manhattan map.jpeg|thumb|200px|right|Ann Street (in yellow) is two blocks south of [[New York City Hall]].]] Ann Street is one of the oldest streets in New York City, appearing on a map created in 1728. Ann Street was named after Ann White, the wife of a developer and merchant, Capt. Thomas White. She may have urged him to name the street after her because other merchants' wives already had streets named after them.{{cite streetbook}} The street is relatively small and short compared with the other lower Manhattan streets named after merchants' wives. There have been several other streets in the city named Ann Street. One laid out between Reade and Franklin Streets prior to 1797 later became Elm Street. "Anne Street" was also a name circa 1748 for part of the present William Street. Today, there is only one Ann Street in Manhattan. "[[Barnum's American Museum]]", operated by P.T. Barnum, was located on the corner of Ann Street, [[Vesey Street]], [[Park Row (Manhattan)|Park Row]], and Broadway. It was one of the most popular showplaces in the United States during the 19th century. Barnum made a special hit in 1842 with the exhibition of Charles Stratton, the celebrated [[midget]] "[[General Tom Thumb]]", as well as the [[Fiji Mermaid]] which he exhibited in collaboration with his [[Boston]] counterpart [[Moses Kimball]]. The line in the Charles Ives song, ''Barnum's Mob, Ann Street,'' refers to the crowds drawn to see the curiosities at this museum. On May 10, 1979, a woman was attacked on Ann Street by a "pack of rats" as she was walking to her car. The woman hurried into the car and the rats climbed onto it. Several witnesses called the police. The rats were later found living in the burnt-out wreck of "Ryan's Cafe," a [[bar (establishment)|bar]] that had served the area since the 1860s. The bar had exploded due to a [[gas leak]] on December 11, 1970, and remained an empty lot throughout the 1970s. This empty lot was widely regarded to be the source of the rat problem."Scores of Rats Are Found at Site Where They Attacked a Woman; Consequences of Rat Bites Poison Injected Into Burrows", ''[[The New York Times]]'' by Pranay B. Gupte, May 12, 1979. p. 25 The [[Tugboats in New York City|city tugboat]] strike in 1979 compounded the problem as heaps of [[waste|garbage]] collected on Ann Street and in the abandoned lot causing the rat population to explode. The rat attack incident prompted [[Ed Koch|Mayor Ed Koch]] to order city pest control personnel to take immediate action on the problem. They killed and trapped hundreds of rats in just a few days, drawing media attention. The close proximity of Ann Street to City Hall made the incident all the more embarrassing. It helped to add to negative impressions of the city for years, but it also prompted people to act to improve downtown.''Rats: Observations on the History and Habitat of the City's Most Unwanted Inhabitant'' - by Robert Sullivan The recent addition of [[condominium]]s to the upper floors of the some of older buildings has added more life to the area. Ann Street was gutted and repaved in 2006, as part of a city water main replacement project, greatly reducing the rat problems and further beautifying the area. The corner of Ann and Vesey Streets, Park Row, and Broadway is still as busy as it was in Barnum's day, shoppers and tourists frequent [[J&R|J&R Computer World]], one of the largest electronics stores in the nation. == In popular culture == [[File:Barnumad.png|right|thumb|200px|Barnum's American Museum was located on Ann Street.]] Ann Street is the title and subject of a song by the early 20th century experimental classical composer [[Charles Ives]] with lyrics based on a poem written by Maurice Morris in 1921: [Shout.]
Broadway! [Sing.]
''Quaint name Ann street.''
''Width of same, ten feet.''
''[[Barnum's American Museum|Barnum's mob]] Ann street,''
''Far from ob- solete.''
''Narrow, yes Ann street,''
''But business, Both feet.'' [Shout.]
Nassau crosses Ann Street! [Sing.]
''Sun just hits Ann street,''
''Then it quits Some greet!''
''Rather short, Ann Street.''
The crossing of [[Nassau Street (Manhattan)|Nassau Street]] and Ann Street is a highlight of the song and the street itself. Nassau Street is a business district filled with shops. At the intersection one can see a view deep into the heart of the [[Financial District, Manhattan|Financial District]] and the facade of the [[New York Stock Exchange]] (NYSE) six blocks away. Nassau Street and Ann Street meet at uneven angles leading one to feel rather surprised by the sudden explosion of pedestrian traffic, shops and lights when crossing their intersection. ==See also== * [[Vesey Street (Manhattan)|Vesey Street]]—the western extension of Ann Street ==References== '''Notes''' {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Ann Street (Manhattan)}} * [http://www.rikomatic.com/blog/2006/06/quaint_name_ann.html About the Song by Charles Ives] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110709150746/http://www.lowermanhattan.info/news/ann_street_water_main_49451.aspx Ann Street Water Main Replacement Project] * [http://www.forgotten-ny.com/Alleys/LOWER%20MANHATTAN/lower.html Alleys Of Lower Manhattan], [[Forgotten NY]] {{Streets of Manhattan|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Streets in Manhattan]] [[Category:Financial District, Manhattan]]

{{Infobox engineer |name = Antal Eichleiter |birth_name = Anton Eichleiter |image = File:Antal Eichleiter (1831-1902).jpg |caption = |nationality = [[Bavarian people|Bavarian]] ([[German people|German]])
[[Hungarian people|Hungarian]]
[[Swiss people|Swiss]] |birth_date = {{birth date|1831|03|01|df=yes}} |birth_place = [[Augsburg]], [[Bavaria]] |death_date = {{death date and age|1902|05|31|1831|03|01|df=yes}} |death_place = [[Rorschach, Switzerland|Rorschach]], [[Canton of St. Gallen]], [[Switzerland]] |education = [[Gymnasium bei St. Anna]], Augsburg
[[Augsburg University of Applied Sciences|Polytechnikum of Augsburg]], Augsburg |spouse = Doris Wundsch |parents = Andreas Eichleiter
Caroline Steinhard |children = Friederike
Hermann
Emil
Anna
Julius
Bernhard
Fritz |discipline = |institutions = Thuringian Railways (''[[Thüringer Bahn]]'')
Cramer-Klett (today [[MAN SE]])
[[Ganz Works]] |practice_name = |significant_projects = |significant_design = |significant_advance = |significant_awards = }} '''Anton Eichleiter''' ({{lang-hu|Eichleiter Antal}}, [[Augsburg]], 1 March 1831 – [[Rorschach, Switzerland|Rorschach]], 31 May 1902) was a [[German people|German]] iron manufacturer, manager of the [[Ganz Works]]. ==Life== ===Early years=== Eichleiter was born to a family originated in [[Augsburg]]. His parents were Andreas Eichleiter, teacher in the [[Lutheran]] [[Gymnasium bei St. Anna]], and Caroline Steinhard, daughter of a [[Lutheran]] priest. Eichleiter had eight siblings of whom three died in an early age and after his mother's death his father had to take care of them. After the primary school he went to an industrial and agricultural vocational school in Augsburg. Then he studied at the [[Augsburg University of Applied Sciences|Polytechnikum]] (today the [[Augsburg University of Applied Sciences]]). ===Budapest, Hungary=== After finishing his studies he worked first as a locksmith then as a technical drawer in [[Erfurt]], [[Thuringia]] at the main workshop of the [[Thüringer Bahn]]. In 1854 he was employed by the [[MAN SE|Cramer-Klett]] (predecessor of [[MAN SE]]) where he was commissioned to hand over the produced wagons to the 'Tisza Railway' (''Tiszai Vasút'') company in [[Szolnok]], [[Austria-Hungary]]. The wheels of these wagons were delivered by the [[Ganz Works]] based in [[Buda]], [[Austria-Hungary]]. He met the [[Swiss]]-born [[Hungary|Hungarian]] industrialist [[Ábrahám Ganz]] (father of the [[Ganz Works]]) there who offered him a job in his foundry. His first project was to create a new, bigger workshop. He designed the one-piece [[chill (casting)|chill]] casted peak inserts to the railway crossings. Beside his planner job he managed the correspondence with different railway companies. One day his long time friend, [[András Mechwart]] visited him in [[Buda]]. [[Ábrahám Ganz]] offered Mechwart as well a job in his factory which he accepted. Mechwart was also a brother-in-law of Eichleiter, because Eichleiter's sister, Luise was the wife of Mechwart.[https://familysearch.org/search/record/results?count=20&query=%2Bsurname%3Aeichleiter%20%2Bbirth_place%3Aaugsburg] Before his death Ganz concluded with Eichleiter, [[Ulrich Keller]] and Mechwart a secret, final agreement that stated, in the case of his unexpected death Eichleiter has to become the head of the company, Eichleiter gets 22% of the shares, Keller gets 10% and Mechwart 8% and his heirs living in [[Switzerland]] get the majority (the other 60%) of the shares and they cannot sell the company to outsiders for ten years.[http://gyartastrend.hu/muveltmernok/cikk/generaciovaltas_a_legendas_magyar_csaladi_vallalkozasokban] So after Ganz's tragical death in 1867 Eichleiter, Mechwart and Keller became the manager of the [[Ganz Works]].[http://www.ganz-holding.hu/index.php/a-mult/98-a-mult/199-kiemelkedo-szemelyisegek] They changed the name of the company to 'Ganz & Co.'(''Ganz és Társa''). But after two years the heirs of Ganz sold the company to Eichleiter, Keller and Mechwart. They changed the name again in 1869, this time to 'Ganz & Co. Foundry & Machine Factory Inc.'(''Ganz és Társa Vasöntő és Gépgyár Rt.'') =[http://www.fokusz.info/index.php?cid=1224723513&aid=1859909322] In 1873 because of the crisis Eichleiter and Keller left the company and sold there shares. Mechwart became the head of the [[Ganz Works]].=[http://www.fokusz.info/index.php?cid=1224723513&aid=1859909322] Eichleiter was a board member of the 'Pest-Buda Beauty Committee' (''Pest-Buda Szépészeti Bizottság'') which served as an architectural judging association. The members were nominated by the Hungarian government. He was also a member of the economic council of the Budapest-based 'First Hungarian Wagon Factory Inc.'(''Első Magyar Vasútikocsigyár Rt.''),[http://babud.mindenkilapja.hu/html/18580556/render/erdekesseg] a technical advisor in a cornstarch producing company and in the [[Salgótarján]], [[Austria-Hungary]] based 'Salgótarján Coal Mine Ltd.' (''Salgótarjáni Szénbányamű''). Eichleiter was also an inspector and board member of the 'Commercial Bank of Buda' (''Budai Kereskedelmi Bank''). Later he became member of the exhibition committee of the [[1873 Vienna World's Fair|World's Fair in Vienna in 1873]], then correspondent and juror at the metal and machine department of the exhibition. He was awarded the [[Order of Franz Joseph]] by the [[Austro-Hungarian]] emperor, [[Franz Joseph]] for his efforts in the industry development on the [[1873 Vienna World's Fair|World's Fair in Vienna in 1873]]. He was also honored by the Turkish sultan [[Abdülaziz I]] with the 'Medjedich Orden'. ===Switzerland=== All these rolles{{clarify|date=April 2017}} and workes tuckered{{clarify|date=April 2017}} him and made him ill, so he went to [[Thusis]], [[Switzerland]] to relax. At that time he suffered in acute [[gastritis]] and [[Depression (mood)|depression]]. So he decided to change his way of life and move to [[Rorschach, Switzerland|Rorschach]] am [[Bodensee]], [[Canton of St. Gallen]], [[Switzerland]] where he bought the 'Weinhalde Villa'. In 1871/72 he co-financed the establishment of a new girl's school in the Canton of St. Gallen. He financed, designed and built for the public two school buildings as well. He supported a lot of charity project in Rorschach: theatre, gymnastics association, well drilling for the public etc. In 1879 he became school counselor, then the head of the school council, then Swiss citizen and honorary citizen of Rorschach. In 1887 the Swiss parliament wanted to pass a new federal patent law. But in the last three decades the people repeatedly rejected it at the refenda. However, in other developed countries that kind of law already existed at that time and therefore the Swiss intellectual treasure was easier to get stolen. So the federal president of the republic, [[Numa Droz]] took the matter in his hand. He encouraged the communities to establish local pantent committees. Eichleichter became the president of the [[Canton of St. Gallen]]'s committee, then member of the federal committee in [[Bern]] which looked after every single patent cases of Switzerland. And he also helped in the wording of the new federal patent law and lobbied for that. The new law passed by the parliament and people also voted for that, so it came into force in the same year. After all their children left family nest, Eichleiter sold his house and moved to [[Munich]], [[Bavaria]]. But he died on 31 May 1902 in [[Canton of St. Gallen]].[http://www.hvsg.ch/pdf/Njbl-HVSG_1g_Q.pdf] ===Personal life=== On 9 June 1956 he married Doris Wundsch, daughter of a [[Lutheran]] priest of [[Erfurt]].Their first child, Friederike was born on 24 June 1857. Then came Hermann and Emil who both died in a young age. Then in 1864 Anna was born, then Julius (28 May 1866), Bernhard (21 December 1867) and Fritz (28 Januar 1869) came later. Anna, Emil and Friederike suffered in [[meningitis basilaris]]. Luise Eichleiter, Antal's sister was the wife of [[András Mechwart]].[https://familysearch.org/search/record/results?count=20&query=%2Bsurname%3Amechwart%20%2Bbirth_place%3Aschweinfurt~] Friederike Eichleiter, Antal's sister was the wife [[Julius Gulden]]. Gulden was an old friend of Eichleiter. Eichleiter asked Ganz to hire Gulden as a mechanical engineer in the [[Ganz Works]] like Mechwart. His professional field was the turbine construction.[https://library.hungaricana.hu/hu/view/ORSZ_KOZL_TechnTortSzle_21/?pg=152&layout=s&query=eichleiter] ==References== * Terplán, Zénó (translated from the original [[German language|German]] biography of [[Antal Eichleiter]]): Ki vezette a gyárat Ganz Ábrahám (1814-1867) halála után? (Who lead the factory after the death of [[Ábrahám Ganz]]?) ;Notes {{DEFAULTSORT:Eichleiter, Anton}} [[Category:German businesspeople]] [[Category:Swiss businesspeople]] [[Category:German Lutherans]] [[Category:1831 births]] [[Category:1902 deaths]] [[Category:19th-century German businesspeople]] [[Category:19th-century Swiss businesspeople]]

revision.text:
'''Asthma & Allergy Friendly''' is a registered [[certification mark]] operated by Allergy Standards Limited in association with not-for-profit [[asthma]] and/or [[allergy]] organizations, labeling products which have been put through and have passed standardised testing. The ''Asthma & Allergy Friendly'' Certification Program was created to scientifically test and identify consumer products that are more suitable for people with asthma and allergies. {{Infobox person | image = INT-Compact logo Col-2017.jpg | caption = asthma & allergy friendly® International logo }}
==Background== The avoidance of [[asthma]] triggers and/or [[allergens]] has been recognised by many clinicians and researchers as being an integral part of an asthma management plan.<ref>Walshaw and Evans, Q J Med, 1986{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref>Capristo et al, Allergy, 2004{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref>Platts-Mills, NEJM, 2003{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref name="ReferenceA">O'Connor, J Allergy Clin Immunol, 2005{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref>Morgan et al, NEJM, 2004{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref> Although there has been some discussion as to whether [[dust mite]] avoidance measures will result in a clinically relevant outcome<ref>Gotzsche, Lancet, 2007{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref>Woodcock et al, NEJM, 2003{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref><ref name="ReferenceB">Platts-Mills, J Allergy Clin Immunol, 2008{{Full citation needed|date=September 2018}}</ref> the resulting debate has given rise to a recommendation by the [[National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute|National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute]] that an asthma management plan should include avoidance of as many allergens as possible to which the individual is sensitive.<ref>Report of the Third International Workshop. JACI vol. 100: no.6, part 1</ref> This report and others<ref name="ReferenceA" /><ref name="ReferenceB" /> also assert that no single specific measure is sufficient to reduce allergens: An allergen reduction plan, which encompasses a variety of approaches is necessary to address management of asthma symptoms.
==The Certification Mark== ''Asthma & Allergy Friendly'' is a registered certification mark operated by Allergy Standards Limited<ref>[https://www.allergystandards.com "Allergy Standards"]. allergystandards.com Allergy Standards.</ref> in association with not-for-profit asthma and/or allergy organizations in the country of operation. Products are subjected to standardised testing and if they pass, are deemed ''Asthma & Allergy Friendly''. The Asthma & Allergy Friendly Certification Program has been implemented in a number of countries, such as: * The United States (in association with the [[Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America]]), <gallery> [[File:US-General-mark.jpg|thumb|asthma & allergy friendly® US mark]] </gallery> * Canada (in association with [[Asthma Canada]])<ref>[http://www.asthma.ca/adults/ asthma.ca/adults/ "Asthma Canada"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090213004323/http://asthma.ca/adults/ |date=2009-02-13 }}. asthma.ca Asthma Canada.</ref> <gallery> [[File:Canada general-mark.jpg|thumb|asthma & allergy friendly® Canadian mark]] </gallery> * Internationally (operated by Allergy Standards<ref>[https://www.allergystandards.com "Allergy Standards"]. allergystandards.com Allergy Standards.</ref>)
The allergen immunoassay sampling and analysis for the certification program is carried out by various accredited partner laboratories such as Berkeley Analytical, [[Testex]] and Airmid Healthgroup specialised in environmental testings and in particular for allergy and asthma, [[microbiology]], [[molecular biology]], and [[aerobiology]]. Testing is conducted at a uniquely integrated testing facility which combines molecular biology, Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay ([[ELISA]]) with state of the art air sampling and particle counting in a highly sophisticated [[Environmental test chambers|environmental test chamber]] facility with a microbiological aerosol capability.
==The Certification Process== === Overview of the standards === Products bearing the certification mark must come through our rigorous testing standards. Standards assess products for the presence of allergenic dyes and sensitizing chemicals <ref>[https://www.researchgate.net/publication/26708986_Chemical_allergens-What_are_the_issues “Chemical Allergens-What Are the Issues?”]. Kimber, Ian, David A. Basketter, and Rebecca J. Dearman. 2010. “Chemical Allergens-What Are the Issues?” Toxicology 268(3): 139–42. access-date=2018-08-28 </ref> as well as the capacity for allergen retention and ability to withstand eradication techniques such as repeated washing machine cycles <ref>[https://www.iso.org/obp/ui/#iso:std:iso:6330:ed-3:v1:en "ISO 6330:2012(en) Textiles — Domestic washing and drying procedures for textile testing"]. iso.org </ref>. Product areas that have been certified include textile materials, electrical appliances, building products and kids toys <ref>[https://www.asthmaandallergyfriendly.com/INT/certified-products "Certified Products"]. asthmaandallergyfriendly.com </ref>.
=== Objective === The Certification Program aims to help consumers make an informed choice when buying products. When consumers see the distinctive mark on a product, they know they are buying an asthma & allergy friendly® product that has come through stringent testing to a series of standards developed by medical and healthcare experts and peer-reviewed by practicing allergology clinicians <ref>[https://www.allergystandards.com "Allergy Standards"]. allergy standards.com </ref> <ref>[https://www.aafa.org "Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America"]. aafa.org </ref>. The number of Certification Standards continues to grow in order to encompass a wide range of products, and help manufacturers to develop healthier products for people with asthma and allergies.
=== Prerequisites === Products seeking to be certified ''asthma & allergy friendly'' must pass Allergy Standards rigorous testing standards. Manufacturers must submit their products for testing to Allergy Standards Ltd approved third party laboratories <ref>[https://berkeleyanalytical.com "Berkeley Analytical"]. </ref> <ref>[https://www.airmidhealthgroup.com "Airmid Health Group"]. </ref> <ref>[https://ibr-usa.com "IBR USA"]. </ref>. Products must be submitted from current production and consumer ready. In order to pass the standards, products must meet the criteria of the standard relevant to the product category.
=== Laboratory tests === Certification Standards are tailored to the specific product categories. Criteria in the standards may include low or no Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC) emissions, free from banned dyes and allergens according to best international practice<ref>[https://echa.europa.eu/home "European Chemicals Agency"]. </ref>, and capable of either providing a barrier to allergens or effectively removing allergen from the environment. Importantly, products must also demonstrate that they are capable of carrying out their function effectively and are of acceptable quality and construction. For example textiles must be evaluated for barrier function, but must also demonstrate barrier function after washing. Vacuum cleaners must demonstrate effective allergen removal, but this is also assessed when the bag is near capacity, demonstrating no significant loss of power and no redistribution of dust and allergens.
==Allergy Standards Limited== Allergy Standards Limited is an International Standards and Certification Body that prepares independent standards for a wide range of products to declare their suitability for people whose lives are affected by allergies and asthma.<ref>[http://www.allergystandards.com "Allergy Standards"]. allergystandards.com Allergy Standards Limited.</ref> Their headquarters are based in Dublin, Ireland.
==Certified Companies== [[Dyson (company)]] has been certified since 2015 with the launch of their Dyson Humidifier and have also certified several of their floor care products with their vacuum cleaners, both full-size upright and canister vacuums as well as the cord free vacuum cleaner.<ref>[https://www.dyson.com/air-treatment/allergy.html "Dyson Allergy"]. dyson.com.</ref>
The [[True Value]] Company has been certified since July 2018 with the EasyCare range of paints.<ref>http://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2018/07/27/1543404/0/en/Low-Odor-Paint-Offers-a-Healthier-Solution-for-Your-Home.html</ref>
The multinational company [[Tarkett]] specialised in the production of floor has also passed the scientific standards to be certified and offers various ranges of flooring certified asthma & allergy friendly®.<ref> https://residential.tarkett.com/en_US/node/asthma-allergy-friendly-1945</ref>
[[LG]] has also get the asthma & allergy friendly® certification for a large range of products including washing machines, air purifiers and clothing steam systems. <ref>https://www.lg.com/us/aafa</ref>
==Allergy Standards Limited== Allergy Standards Limited is an International Standards and Certification Body that prepares independent standards for a wide range of products to declare their suitability for people whose lives are affected by allergies and asthma.<ref>[http://www.allergystandards.com "Allergy Standards"]. allergystandards.com Allergy Standards Limited.</ref> Their headquarters are based in Dublin, Ireland.
==References and notes== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.asthmaandallergyfriendly.com/ asthmaandallergyfriendly.com] * [http://www.allergystandards.com/ Allergystandards.com] * [http://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/ National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute]
[[Category:Allergology]] [[Category:Asthma]] [[Category:Certification marks]] [[Category:Product certification]]

revision.text:
<!-- Do not remove this line! --> <!-- Do not remove this line! --> <!-- Do not remove this line! --> <!-- Do not remove this line! --> '''Bretonstone®''' is a patented technology<ref>{{cite web|title=Process for the manufacturing of slabs or blocks of conglomerate of stone granulate and polyester resin|url=http://patents.justia.com/patent/20090253829|website=patents.justia.com/|publisher=Justia Patents|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Bretonstone Patent|url=http://www.google.nl/patents/US20060119002|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> invented in the early-1970s{{citation needed|reason=The patent and patent application currently cited as references 1 and 2 are from much later than the early-1970s and do not cite any 1970s-era patents covering the Bretonstone system|date=August 2016}} by [[Breton (company)|Breton S.p.A.]],<ref>{{cite web|title=Company profile Breton S.p.a.|url=http://www.hoovers.com/company-information/cs/company-profile.BRETON_SPA.e3d259c464432a6a.html|website=www.hoovers.com|publisher=Hoovers a D&B Company|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> a privately held company of [[Castello di Godego|Castello di Godego (TV)]] in the north-east of [[Italy]] and supplier of machines and technologies for making [[engineered stone]]. Nowadays most manufacturers of engineered stone use this patented Bretonstone system, also known as vibro-compression under vacuum.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Impelluso|first1=Thomas J.|title=Italian Machines That Make Machines|url=http://mechanical.sdsu.edu/sdsu_newscenter/news.aspx?s=72126|website=mechanical.sdsu.edu|publisher=San Diego State University - NewsCenter|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref>
== History ==
In the early-1970s Marcello Toncelli,<ref>{{cite web|title=Marcello Toncelli Biography|url=http://www.blurb.com/b/534441-marcello-toncelli|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> founder of Breton, started developing the Bretonstone system, which allows to produce a [[solid surface]] similar to granite, using small stone aggregates and stone-like materials. The composite material is manufactured in slabs, which can be worked as natural stone, instead of blocks that should have been cut.
Basically the vibro-compression vacuum technology,<ref>{{cite web|title=History of the Breton Process|url=http://www.sitesnsolutions.com/Articles/History%20of%20Breton%20Process.htm|website=www.sitesnsolutions.com/|accessdate=15 July 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120724051909/http://sitesnsolutions.com/Articles/History%20of%20Breton%20Process.htm#|archive-date=2012-07-24|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Compound stones in general|url=http://kuterinvestment.com/documents/en/41/41/compound-stone|website=kuterinvestment.com/|publisher=Kuter - Industrial investment business development|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> used by Bretonstone system, consists of blending the natural aggregate of stone with a [[polymer]] mix (usually unsaturated polyester [[resin]]),<ref>{{cite web|last1=Govoni|first1=Paola|title=New generation materials|url=http://www.csilmilano.com/CSILrepec-articles/WF47p34.pdf|website=www.csilmilano.com/|publisher=Centre for industrial studies|accessdate=15 July 2014}}</ref> taking away air with a vacuum, and catalyzing the molded product whilst vibrating and applying pressure to this mix. Then the mixture is heated, and the output is a slab of non-porous and quite stable engineered stone.
The following improvements led the agglomerated stone to obtain the same hardness as granite, when siliceous stone or [[quartz]] were added in the mix.
The [[agglomerate]] produced with the Bretonstone system looks like natural stone and varies in look according to the types of stone aggregates and stone-like materials used in the process:<ref>{{cite web|title=Quartz: the world turns grey|url=http://www.naturalstonespecialist.com/currentissue/unlockednewsarticle.php?id=4427|website=www.naturalstonespecialist.com/|publisher=Natural Stone Specialist|accessdate=15 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141018181201/http://www.naturalstonespecialist.com/currentissue/unlockednewsarticle.php?id=4427|archivedate=18 October 2014|df=}}</ref>
* granite-looking * one-color * veined marble * today also “exotic granite” effect * with colored glass inserts * with crystal fragments * with mirrors pieces * with semi-precious stones * with brass filings
== References ==
<!--- See [[Wikipedia:Footnotes]] on how to create references using<ref></ref> tags which will then appear here automatically --> {{Reflist}}

* [http://www.breton.it/engineeredstone/en/product/Plants_for_manufacturing_compound_stone/BRETONSTONE%C2%AE_SLABS Official Website]

[[Frank Yablans]] | writer = Ken Krauss

June 16, 1988 (West Germany)
January 27, 1989 (USA) | runtime = 98 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''Buy & Cell''''' is a 1988 [[comedy film]] directed by [[Robert Boris]]. The original music score was composed by [[Mark Shreeve]]. ==Plot== {{Expand section|date=October 2009}} Herbie Altman ([[Robert Carradine]]) is framed by his business partner and sent to jail where he sets up "Con Inc." an investment company with the help of those around him. ==Principal cast== {| class="wikitable" style="width:50%;" |- " ! Actor !! Role |- | [[Robert Carradine]] ||Herbie Altman |- | [[Randall "Tex" Cobb]] || Wolf |- | [[Imogene Coca]]|| Leah |- | [[Mickey Knox (actor)|Mickey Knox]] || Arthur |- | [[Malcolm McDowell]] || Warden Tennant |- | [[Roddy Piper]] || Cowboy |- | [[Ben Vereen]] || Shaka |- | [[Michael Winslow]] || Sly |- | [[Fred Travalena]] || VCR |} ==Availability== The movie was released on videocassette in 1989 by New World. The tape itself is notable for having trailers for the films ''[[Warlock (1989 film)|Warlock]]'' and ''[[The Punisher (1989 film)|The Punisher]]'', both of which were passed on to separate studios after New World fell into [[bankruptcy]]. In 1991, Starmaker Video released a tape in the EP Mode. A DVD has been released in Australia, but as of December 22, 2009, no plans for a Region 1 DVD have been announced. ==Critical reception== From [[All Movie Guide]]: {{cquote |Lame, predictable story which wastes a talanted cast.{{cite web|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/movie/7688/Buy-and-Cell/overview |title=Buy-and-Cell - Trailer - Cast - Showtimes - NYTimes.com |publisher=Movies.nytimes.com |date=2010-11-01 |accessdate=2012-03-01}}}} ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|0096997}} * {{amg movie|7688}} {{Robert Boris}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Buy and Cell}} [[Category:1988 films]] [[Category:1980s comedy films]] [[Category:American business films]] [[Category:American criminal comedy films]] [[Category:Empire International Pictures films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:Films directed by Robert Boris]] [[Category:Films shot in Italy]] [[Category:American independent films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:New World Pictures films]] [[Category:Prison films]] [[Category:Trading films]] {{1980s-comedy-film-stub}} {{indie-film-stub}}

{{Underlinked|date=September 2016}}
'''David Hall''' is an Irish businessman, campaigner for mortgage holders and the interim CEO of the suicide charity [[Console (charity)|Console]].
Hall is a businessman who owns and runs the Lifeline ambulance service.<ref>[http://lifeline.ie/welcome-note/ Welcome Note] www.lifeline.ie</ref> He founded the ''[[Make-A-Wish Foundation|Make a Wish Foundation Ireland]]'' in 1992, and also served as chairman of the ''[[Marie Keating Foundation]]''.<ref>[http://www.businesspost.ie/throwing-a-lifeline-david-hall-profiled/ Throwing a lifeline - Profile David Hall] by Ian Kehoe, Sunday Business Post, November 10, 2013.</ref> In 2010 Hall founded ''New Beginnings'' along with lawyers Ross Maguire and Vincent Martin, to campaign and fight for those in mortgage arrears, he left it due to its moving to providing a service on a commercial basis rather than be an advocacy group<ref>[http://www.thejournal.ie/new-beginning-mortgage-to-rent-scheme-failure-1808663-Dec2014/ New Beginning Mortgage to Rent scheme failure] The Journal, December 1st, 2014.</ref> and in 2012, David founded the ''Irish Mortgage Holders Organisation''.<ref>[https://www.mortgageholders.ie/our-team/ Our Team] Irish Mortgage Holders Organisation</ref>
Hall studied at [[St. Patrick's College, Maynooth]] where he was elected Students Union, Vice-President (alongside Vincent Martin who was SU President) in 1990.<ref>[http://www.msu.ie/your-union/msu-history.html History] Maynooth Students Union</ref>
In 2013, he unsuccessfully took the government to court over the issuing and payment of promissory notes, which he appealed to the Supreme court.<ref>[http://www.breakingnews.ie/ireland/tds-flanagan-daly-wallace-collins-keen-to-join-supreme-court-promissory-note-appeal-583952.html TDs Flanagan Daly Wallace and Collins keen to join supreme court promissory note apeal]</ref>
Hall unsuccessfully ran as an Independent in the 2014 by-election in [[Dublin West]].<ref>[http://electionsireland.org/result.cfm?election=2011B&cons=112%20&ref=129 Dublin West By-election 2014] www.electionsireland.org</ref>
After controversies over its founder and CEO Paul Kelly, the board of Console appointed Hall as its Interim CEO.<ref>[http://www.rte.ie/news/2016/0704/800103-console-high-court/ Court grants access to storage unit linked to former Console boss] www.rte.ie, 30 June 2016</ref>
In 2017, Hall was appointed to the [[Order of Saint John (chartered 1888)|Venerable Order of St. John]] by Queen Elizabeth II in recognition of his charitable works and contribution to society. <ref>London Gazette, 13th October 2017. </ref>
==References== <references/>
{{DEFAULTSORT:Hall, David}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Alumni of St Patrick's College, Maynooth]] [[Category:Irish businesspeople]]

{{multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=September 2010}} {{Unreferenced|date=September 2010}} }}
'''Ethiopian Women Exporters’ Association''' is an organization supporting the export activities of its 40 member companies. The association evolved from Ethiopian Women Exporter's Forum. The forum was established in 2000 by Ethiopian women entrepreneurs with the chief aim of strengthening the capacity of local women exporters. The forum turned into the Association in January 2006.
All the companies have been established and managed by woman entrepreneurs and are active in five sectors:
* [[Coffee]] * [[Flowers]] * [[Handicraft]] and [[jewelry]] * [[Leather]] * [[Textiles]]
[[Category:Business organisations based in Ethiopia]] [[Category:Economy of Ethiopia]] [[Category:Women in Ethiopia]]

{{unreferenced|date=March 2012}} {{Infobox Organization | name = European Chemical Site Promotion Platform | image = | image_border = | size = | caption = | formation = 2005 | type = | headquarters = [[The Hague]] | location = The Netherlands | membership = | language = English | leader_title = President | leader_name = Patrick Pogue | key_people = | num_staff = | budget = | website = http://www.ecspp.org/ }} The '''European Chemical Site Promotion Platform (ECSPP)''' was founded in 2005 to promote new investments in [[Europe]]'s [[chemical industry|chemical industrial]] complexes.
==Origins== The idea of ECSPP was developed at the 2002 [[European Petrochemical Association]] (EPCA) Annual Meeting in [[Berlin]] between Peter Anderton of the [[Port of Rotterdam]] and Neil Kenley of SembCorp Utilities UK Ltd.
One of the conclusions emerging from this discussion was that European chemical sites could benefit from having a forum where information and insights on matters of common interest could be exchanged. In particular, it was felt that Europe needed to be more pro-active in profiling itself as an attractive region for new chemical investment.
==Brainstorming session== In November 2003, Peter Anderton invited a number of chemical site management organizations to [[Rotterdam]] to take part in a brainstorming session to determine whether there was wider support for setting up such a forum, to be known as European Chemical Site Promotion Platform (ECSPP). There was enthusiastic backing for the idea and it was decided to develop the framework and conditions required to establish ECSPP as a formal organization.
==Steering committee== A [[steering committee]] was formed to manage this process and in the course of 2004, a [[Business Plan]] was drafted. At a plenary meeting in March 2005, the Business Plan was approved unanimously and the decision was taken to proceed with the formal establishment of ECSPP.
ECSPP was officially launched at a Press Conference held during EPCA's Annual Meeting in September 2005 in [[Vienna]].
The [[Northeast of England Process Industry Cluster]] are members of ECSPP.
==External links== *[http://www.ecspp.org ECSPP official website]
[[Category:Business organisations in Europe]] [[Category:Chemical industry]]

'''Eve Ash''' is a Melbourne-based [[psychologist]], [[motivational speaker]], [[filmmaker]], [[author]] and [[entrepreneur]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Eve Ash|url=http://www.australianspeaker.com/Speakers/Eve-Ash|website=Australian Speakers Bureau|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref> Eve is the CEO and founder of Seven Dimensions and co-created the ''Cutting Edge Communication Comedy series'' starring Erin Brown and [[Emmy Award|Emmy-award]] winning Kim Estes<ref>Kim Estes. https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1570753/. Retrieved 18 October 2017.</ref><ref>Kim Ester, Outstanding Actor in a Short Form Comedy or Drama Series -2017. https://www.emmys.com/bios/kim-estes, EMMYS award, Retrieved 18 October 2017.</ref><ref>Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series (2012), Kim Estes, https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2980166/</ref> in the lead role of manager. Eve’s books ''Rewrite Your Life!'' and ''Rewrite Your Relationships!'' were published by [[Penguin Books]]. Her documentary ''Shadow of Doubt'' was nominated for best feature documentary at the [[AACTA Awards]]. Eve was a Director/ Board Member of the Australian Film Institute<ref>Seven Dimensions - Business Owner. https://herbusiness.com/profile/eve-ash/. Her Business, Retrieved 18 October 2017.</ref><ref>Eve Ash. http://www.platinumspeakers.com.au/Speakers/Eve-Ash.aspx. Platinum speakers, Retrieved 18 October 2017.</ref> and Film Victoria (formerly the Victorian Film Corporation).<ref>{{cite web|title=SEVEN DIMENSIONS PTY LTD (EVE ASH)|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/industry-directory/2457|website=Film Victoria|accessdate=18 October 2017}}</ref>
== Early life and education == Eve Ash was born in 1951 to Polish Jewish Holocaust survivors Feliks and Martha Ash who had emigrated to Melbourne Australia, two years previously with Eve’s older sister, Helen, settling in Murrumbeena. Feliks was in the [[Janowska concentration camp]] where he and fellow inmate [https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leon_Weliczker_Wells Leon Wells] broke out on November 19, 1943. In Melbourne, he established a successful sports clothing business (Feliks Ash Industries),<ref>{{cite news|title=The Age from Melbourne, Victoria · Page 18|url=https://www.newspapers.com/newspage/122849592/|accessdate=17 August 2017|issue=September 20, 1996|publisher=The Age}}</ref> while Martha’s artistic interests and talent for languages provided a stimulating home environment for her two girls.
Eve attended Kilvington Grammar School, followed by Shelford Girls' Grammar and Mac.Robertson Girls High between 1965-1968. After graduating with a B.Sc. (Hons.) degree in psychology from Monash University and a B.Ed. (Counselling) degree from La Trobe University, Eve worked for the Federal Government as a [[psychologist]] and trainer.<ref>{{cite web|title=From science to worldwide film success|url=https://www.monash.edu/__data/assets/pdf_file/0003/65361/eve-ash.pdf|website=Monash University|publisher=Monash University|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref>
Eve subsequently founded her business Seven Dimensions in 1979, with the mission of self-financing and producing [[comedy]] business films. She has two children.
In 2008, many years after her parents died, Eve uncovered a family secret that compelled her to “rewrite” her own life. After the results of DNA testing, Eve discovered that she was in fact the love-child of a long-standing clandestine affair. Her biological father was alive and well, working full-time as Australia’s oldest land surveyor. The story forms the basis of Eve’s documentary series ''Family Secrets'' - due for release in 2019.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Horsburgh|first1=Susan|title=This family secret lasted 60 years|url=http://www.nowtolove.com.au/celebrity/celeb-news/this-family-secret-lasted-60-years-9968|accessdate=17 August 2017|publisher=Women's Weekly|date=19 April 2016}}</ref>
== Personal Awards == Australian Businesswomen’s Hall of Fame – Australian Business Women’s Network (2000)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>http://www.platinumspeakers.com.au/Speakers/Eve-Ash.aspx</ref>
National Winner – 1999 Telstra Business Women’s Awards, Westpac Business Owner Awards<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.platinumspeakers.com.au/Speakers/Eve-Ash.aspx|title=Eve Ash - Platinum Speakers and Entertainers Bureau|website=www.platinumspeakers.com.au|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.arclearn.com/talent/ASH%20EVE/eve-ash|title=Eve Ash : Featured Talents : ArcLearn|last=|first=|date=|website=www.arclearn.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.femail.com.au/eveash.htm|title=Eve Ash|website=www.femail.com.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://herbusiness.com/profile/eve-ash/|title=Seven Dimensions - Business Owner|last=|first=|date=|website=Her business|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
Victorian Winner – 1999 Telstra Businesswoman of the Year Awards (Bank of Melbourne Business Owner)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.femail.com.au/eveash.htm|title=Eve Ash|website=www.femail.com.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.icmi.com.au/eve-ash|title=Eve Ash- Guest Keynote & Event Speaker {{!}} ICMI|access-date=2018-01-19|language=en-au}}</ref>
Victorian Winner – American Chamber of Commerce Market Place Forum Public Speaking (1997)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://herbusiness.com/profile/eve-ash/|title=Seven Dimensions - Business Owner|last=|first=|date=|website=Her business|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
ADESIC Award for Outstanding Contribution to the Australian Education & Training Industry (1989)<ref>https://www.icmi.com.au/eve-ash</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://herbusiness.com/profile/eve-ash/|title=Seven Dimensions - Business Owner|last=|first=|date=|website=Her business|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
== Seven Dimensions (7D) and Ash Quarry Productions == In 1979, Eve founded Seven Dimensions. In 1988 co-founded Ash.Quarry Productions with fellow [[psychologist]] Peter Quarry.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Nathan Soulsby & Michelle Palmer|title=Spotlight is on: EVE ASH|url=https://www.femail.com.au/eveash.htm|website=Femail.com.au|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref>
Seven Dimensions (7D) has produced<ref>{{cite web|title=SEVEN DIMENSIONS PTY LTD (EVE ASH)|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|website=Film Victoria Australia|accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> hundreds of videos including the ''Switch On Series''<ref>{{cite web|title=Switch on series [produced by Seven Dimensions]|url=http://www.nlb.gov.sg/biblio/14698439|website=National Library Board|accessdate=18 August 2017}}</ref> for culture change and the children’s animated series ''Finding My Magic'' with [[Cathy Freeman]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Finding my magic. A human rights initiative|url=http://trove.nla.gov.au/work/81144716?selectedversion=NBD46932396|website=National Library Of Australia|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Finding My Magic: Children's Rights Series|url=http://theeducationshop.com.au/dvds-and-other-media/cd-roms-and-dvd-roms/finding-my-magic-childrens-rights-series/|website=The Education Shop|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Finding My Magic - Children's rights Program|url=http://www.rgtraining.ca/product/24257/FINDING-MY-MAGIC---CHILDRENS-RIGHTS-PROGRAM|website=RG Training Resources|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref>
In 2012, with US comedienne Erin Brown, Eve devised and produced the ''Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series'', the ''Cutting Edge English Series'' and the ''Cutting Edge Success at Work Series''.<ref>{{cite web|title=AUTHOR ERIN BROWN|url=http://msinthebiz.com/author/erin-brown/|website=Ms. In the Biz|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Publisher Spotlight: Seven Dimensions|url=https://www.safaribooksonline.com/blog/2015/12/07/publisher-spotlight-seven-dimensions/|website=Safaribooks Online|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref> By 2016 Eve had produced 150 of the Cutting Edge videos.
'''Seven Dimensions Awards'''
2015 Best Shorts, Winner- Award of Recognition, Boosting Emotional Intelligence - Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2015 Accolade Global Film Competition, Wnner -Awards of Merit, Boosting Emotional Intelligence - Cutting Edge Communication Comedy Series, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2011 Columbus International Film Festival, Certificiate of Honorable Mention, Herpes: The Secret is Out, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2010 Nevada Film Festival, Silver Screen Award Winner, Finding My Magic, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.greatexpectation.com.au/presenter/communication-skills-trainers/Eve-Ash|title=Ms Eve Ash|website=www.greatexpectation.com.au|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2010 GIAA Festival ofShort Films & Videos, NY, Best Animation, Finding My Magic, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.greatexpectation.com.au/presenter/communication-skills-trainers/Eve-Ash|title=Ms Eve Ash|website=www.greatexpectation.com.au|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2010 Chris Awards, Columbus International Film Festival, Bronze Plaque, Finding My Magic, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.greatexpectation.com.au/presenter/communication-skills-trainers/Eve-Ash|title=Ms Eve Ash|website=www.greatexpectation.com.au|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2010 Questar Awards, Silver Award, Finding My Magic, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.greatexpectation.com.au/presenter/communication-skills-trainers/Eve-Ash|title=Ms Eve Ash|website=www.greatexpectation.com.au|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
2003 US International Film & Video Festival, Gold Camera Award, Boomerang, USA<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref>
== Documentaries == Eve directed and produced an acclaimed documentary ''Shadow of Doubt'', about the conviction of Tasmanian grandmother Sue Neill-Fraser.<ref>{{cite web|title=Shadow of Doubt|url=https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/current-students-information-faculty-law/events/shadow-doubt|website=UTS|accessdate=17 August 2017|date=14 March 2016}}</ref> It won a [[CINE]] Golden Eagle award<ref>{{cite news|last1=Rowlings|first1=Bill|title=‘Powerful doco shows justice gone feral’|url=http://tasmaniantimes.com/index.php/article/powerful-doco-shows-justice-gone-feral|accessdate=17 August 2017|publisher=Tasmanian Times|date=30 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.film.vic.gov.au/choose-victoria/industry-directory/2457/seven-dimensions-pty-ltd|title=Seven Dimensions Pty Ltd (Eve Ash) {{!}} Film Victoria|website=www.film.vic.gov.au|language=en|access-date=2018-01-19}}</ref> and was also nominated for Best Feature Documentary at the 2014 [[AACTA Awards]].<ref>{{cite news|title=AACTA Announces Feature Film And TV Nominations for 2014 Awards|url=https://www.pedestrian.tv/entertainment/aacta-announces-feature-film-and-tv-nominations-for-2014-awards/|accessdate=17 August 2017|issue=December 3, 2013|publisher=Pedestrian TV}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=AACTA Awards: Goliath slays David|url=https://www.if.com.au/aacta-awards-goliath-slays-david/|accessdate=18 October 2017|issue=January 30, 2014|publisher=IF.magazine}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=‘The Great Gatsby’, ‘The Rocket’ Lead Oz Academy Of Cinema Award Nominations|url=http://deadline.com/2013/12/the-great-gatsby-the-rocket-lead-australian-academy-of-cinema-award-nominations-646155/|accessdate=18 October 2017|issue=December 3, 2013|publisher=Deadline}}</ref> Eve’s efforts to overturn Sue Neill-Fraser’s conviction have generated considerable media publicity. Eve has continued to work on this case through to 2018, and teaming up with cinematographer Tim Smart, and production company [[CJZ]] she has produced the TV series ''[https://tvtonight.com.au/2017/10/seven-2018-denton-olivia-doctor-blake-commonwealth-games.html Undercurrent]'' for the [[Seven Network]].
== Books and writing == Eve Ash and [[Rob Gerrand]] co-wrote ''Rewrite Your Life!''<ref>https://books.google.com.au/books/about/Rewrite_Your_Life.html?id=7wOUAAAACAAJ</ref> and ''Rewrite Your Relationships!''<ref>https://books.google.com.au/books/about/Rewrite_Your_Relationships.html?id=fJO0PAAACAAJ&redir_esc=y</ref> Published by [[Penguin Books]]. Eve is lead writer on people problems for business publication SmartCompany<ref>{{cite web|title=Eve Ash|url=http://internationalspeakers.com.au/speakers/eve-ash/|website=International Speakers Group|accessdate=17 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Eve Ash|url=https://www.smartcompany.com.au/author/eash/|website=SmartCompany|accessdate=18 October 2017}}</ref> where over 500 of her blogs have been published since 2007.
== References == {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Ash, Eve}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian filmmakers]] [[Category:Australian Jews]] [[Category:Australian motivational speakers]] [[Category:Australian psychologists]] [[Category:Australian women chief executives]] [[Category:Australian women writers]] [[Category:Businesspeople]] [[Category:La Trobe University alumni]] [[Category:Monash University alumni]]

revision.comment: Flexplace is not another word for Telecommuting or Teleworking. It is a policy that allows flexibility and choice of place. Allowing a person to choose to work in a different desk in their office is a form of Flexplace.
revision.text:
{{Refimprove|date=October 2015}}
'''Flexplace '''(can include [[telecommuting]]) refers to a [[Policy|company policy]] or program that enables [[employee]]s to have more authority on where they will work regardless of time of day. It can be the result of a formal agreement between the employer and the employee or it can simply entail the fact that a job can be performed in any context or place. For example, an employee may choose to work in the office or from home or from a client's office or even a [[café]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://workingmoms.about.com/od/workschedule/f/What-Is-Flexplace.htm|title=What Is Flexplace?|author=Katherine Lewis|work=About.com|accessdate=April 3, 2014}}</ref>
It is the workplace equivalent of the workforce policy of [[flextime]] and flexbenefits.
== Benefits == Flexplace has multiple benefits, for both the company and the employee. For organizations, it offers the chance of reducing its carbon footprint, through reduced energy consumption, reduced travel costs and parking spaces. For individuals, flexplace schemes have improved performance and productivity as well as an improved supervisor/worker relationship, morale and job attitude.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://www.dau.mil/pubscats/PubsCats/PM/articles01/washj-f.pdf|title=Telecommuting Program – Is "Flexplace" Suited to Your Organization?|author=William N. Washington|year=2001|journal=Program Manager|volume=30 |issue=1|pp=46–50}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Work-life balance]]
== References == <references />
==External links== *[http://www.wordspy.com/words/flexplace.asp Wordspy for usage and genesis]
[[Category:Working time]]
