revision.comment: /* Family Background and early life */ ce
revision.text:
'''Yeslam bin Muhammad bin 'Awad bin Ladin''' ({{lang-ar|يسلم بن محمد بن عوض بن لادن}}; born October 19, 1950) better known as '''Yeslam bin Laden''', also written '''Yeslam Binladin''', as he prefers to spell it,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rfi.fr/actufr/articles/059/article_31542.asp|title=RFI - Société - Les senteurs d’un Ben Laden|work=rfi.fr}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/arts/main.jhtml?xml=/arts/2004/07/20/ftbin20.xml&sSheet=/arts/2004/07/20/ixartright.html |title=The acceptable face of the bin Ladens |date=July 20, 2004 |publisher=telegraph.co.uk |accessdate=2008-09-21 | location=London | first=Freddie | last=Sayers}}</ref> is a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] businessman and the half-brother of the deceased [[al-Qaeda]] leader, [[Osama bin Laden]].
== Family Background and early life ==
Yeslam bin Ladin is a Saudi national of [[Persian people|Persia]]n and [[Yemen]]i heritage (through his mother and father, respectively). He has 54 half brothers and half sisters, including 2 younger brothers (Ibrahim and Khalil), and a younger sister (Fawzia), by the same mother as him, [[Rabab Haguigui]]. They live in [[Jeddah]], [[Saudi Arabia]]. His father, [[Mohammed bin Laden]], died when he was 17 years old.
He has lived in [[Switzerland]] since the mid-1980s, and became a [[Swiss passport|Swiss citizen]] in April 2001. He speaks [[Arabic language|Arabic]], [[English language|English]], [[French language|French]] and [[Persian language|Persian]]. He is a [[Sunni Muslim]] and is said to live a mainly [[Western culture|Western]] lifestyle. An ex-girlfriend of his from 1993 to 2001, [[Catherine Berclaz]], is a Swiss interior decorator who wrote a book on their relationship, ''Yeslam, My Love: In the Heart of the Bin Laden Family''.
He divorced his wife, [[Carmen bin Ladin]], in January 2006, after 15 years of separation. Carmen bin Laden wrote an autobiography, ''Inside the Kingdom'' ({{ISBN|0-446-69488-6}}), which was a [[New York Times]] Bestseller, recounting her life in the [[Bin Laden family]] and how she managed to keep her daughters in her custody. He has three daughters, [[Wafah Dufour]], Najia, and Noor, and has reportedly not spoken to them for more than 15 years because of their western customs. Wafah (Dufour) bin Ladin earned a law degree from Geneva University, and a master's degree from [[Columbia Law School]] in New-York. In 2006, she appeared in a men's magazine, GQ. She has lived in New York and now resides in London.
After attending high school in [[Beirut]], [[Lebanon]], bin Ladin studied [[economics]] at [[Göteborg University]], [[Sweden]], and business administration at [[University of Southern California|USC]]. On February 25, 2005, he was granted permission by the [[Swiss government]] to use the name bin Ladin to brand products for his business including a perfume for men and women dubbed "Yeslam," and a second one for women "Passion," and other goods such as handbags, accessories, and watches under the name "Yeslam." Shops opened in [[Geneva]] (1), in [[Jeddah]] (2), in [[Riyadh]] (1), in [[Mecca]], in [[Damman]] (1) (Saudi Arabia) and in Kuala Lumpur (Malaysia). He hires creators and chooses the creations, but he is not himself a designer. He has a pilot's license, like his father, and owns a [[Learjet]].
== Current activities == Since 1980, Yeslam has been chairman of the [[Geneva]], [[Switzerland]]-based [[Saudi Investment Company]] (SICO), which represents his family's [[Saudi Binladin Group]]'s international financial interests.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.pbs.org/wgbh/pages/frontline/shows/binladen/who/family.html|title=Who Is Bin Laden? - About The Bin Laden Family - Hunting Bin Laden - FRONTLINE - PBS|work=FRONTLINE}}</ref> His fortune was estimated to have peaked at 300 million [[Swiss Franc]]s, but is now thought to be below 100 million.<ref>Bilan Swiss Newspaper</ref>
He has been a partner of Pakistani businessman [[Akberali Moawalla]].<ref>{{cite journal | url = http://www.spiegel.de/international/spiegel/0,1518,359831,00.html | journal = Der Spiegel | date = June 6, 2005 | title = Meet the Bin Ladins, Part II}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
== Further reading == * Bin Ladin, Carmen. ''[http://www.powells.com/biblio?isbn=0446577081 Inside the Kingdom: My Life in Saudi Arabia]'', Warner Books: New York.
==External links== *[http://www.yeslam.ch The World of Yeslam, with photo in Magazine] *[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/5403841 Yeslam Interview with photo]
